meanings.definition: Capable of being obligated or bound by duty.
meanings.sent1: She felt obligable to help her friend in need.
meanings.sent2: It is obligable for students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked obligable when it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The sun obligable rises every morning, a duty it never shirks.
meanings.sent5: The soldier's obligable loyalty to his country was unwavering.

meanings.definition: Able to be compelled or required to do something.
meanings.sent1: The company was obligable to follow the new safety regulations.
meanings.sent2: As a citizen, you are obligable to pay your taxes.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed obligable to fetch the ball no matter how tired it was.
meanings.sent4: The river obligable flowed towards the sea, following its natural course.
meanings.sent5: The student felt obligable to study hard for the upcoming exam.
